p: β-Caryophyllene concentration in the control EO was 9.1%, which was low compared with its concentration in the EO of other registered cultivars grown in the same location [ 29]. In the latter report, the concentration of β-caryophyllene was 15.4–26.8% in wild hemps, and 25–40% in eight registered hemp cultivars, and 6.5–7.5% in the EO of U.S. hemp strain grown for commercial production of CBD [ 29]. Apparently, different cultivars can accumulate and yield vastly different concentrations of β-caryophyllene even when they are grown in the same location and under the same agronomic practices. Overall, β-caryophyllene in the EO of this study was within previously reported ranges [ 20, 27, 43, 44].
